de.must.print
Class ProportionalListReportDirectly

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      de.must.middle.InterruptibleBatchThread
          de.must.print.ProportionalListReportDirectly
All Implemented Interfaces:
Controllable, ProportionalListReport, java.awt.print.Printable, java.lang.Runnable
public abstract class ProportionalListReportDirectly
extends InterruptibleBatchThread
implements ProportionalListReport, java.awt.print.Printable

Direct print implementation of the report interface for lists with proportional column definition. This is a way of printing by a view lines of code as done in de.must.samples.PrintDirectlySample. Word wrap of continuous text is supported as well as table printing. The paradigm of this sample is - back to the roots: Don't call me, I'll call you. This means e.g., I read some database tables, compute some stuff and put it out in the sequence as I am used to. The result is buffered, at the moment in Vectors. After that the result is provided in a sequence, the renderer (printer) wants to retrieve it (e.g. page 1, page 2, again page 1).

See Also:
de.must.samples.PrintDirectlySample

fillPageHeader

protected void fillPageHeader()
Fills the header of each page. Useful if header contains variable data like e.g. group fields. Override it to build page header with variable data. Will be called automatically each time a new page is build.

printFixStuff

protected void printFixStuff(java.awt.Graphics graphics,
                             java.awt.print.PageFormat pageFormat,
                             int pageIndex)
Prints fix stuff for each page. Override this method to use it, it is called each time a page should be rendered.

Parameters:
graphics - the context into which the page is drawn
pageFormat - the size and orientation of the page being drawn
pageIndex - the zero based index of the page to be drawn

fillList

protected abstract void fillList()
Called when print is called the first time, therefore Graphics is known. Thus, all positions may be computed. Put all your instructions to print (like add...) inside this method. Call start() to start thread in order to trigger fillList() to be called.

changeFontIfNew
